column1: #Text=[0312]Palladium acetate (101.8 mg) was dissolved in DMF (25 mL) in an argon atmosphere.
#Text=To this solution, 1,3-bis(diphenylphosphino)propane (373.9 mg) was added and the mixture was stirred at room temperature for 15 min.
#Text=Subsequently, the compound of Example 67 (4.25 g) in DMF (65 mL), ethyl-1-propenyl ether (15.0 mL) and triethylamine (3.8 mL) were added and the mixture was stirred at 80.degree.
#Text=The reaction was terminated by adding water and the mixture was extracted three times with ethyl acetate.
#Text=The organic layer was washed with saturated brine and dried over sodium sulfate, followed by evaporation of the solvent under reduced pressure.
#Text=THF (50 mL) and 3 mol/L hydrochloric acid (50 mL) were added and the mixture was stirred at room temperature for 16 hours.
#Text=Subsequently, the mixture was extracted three times with ethyl acetate.
#Text=The organic layer was washed with saturated brine and dried over sodium sulfate.
#Text=Evaporation of the solvent under reduced pressure and purification by silica gel column chromatography (hexane:ethyl acetate=6:1) afforded the title compound as a yellow powder (670 mg).
